newsitem.title: UK: Eidos signs agreement with Looking Glass.
newsitem.headline: Eidos signs agreement with Looking Glass.

text.p: Eidos Plc, developer and publisher of entertainment software, said on Monday that its subsidiary Eidos Interactive had signed an exclusive four-year publishing and distribution agreement with Looking Glass Technologies, a U.S. based software developer.

The agreement includes the launch of a golf simulation game, called British Open Championship Golf, for the North American market. Eidos Interactive will act as the sales and distribution arm for Looking Glass in North America and also as the exclusive publisher in Europe.
British Open Championship Golf, which is due for launch in March exclusively in North America, will be the first product to be released under this agreement.

It features two actual British Open Championship courses at St. Andrews in Scotland and Royal Troon, play-by-play commentary from ABC Sports announcer Jim McKay, an interactive caddie to help with difficult shots, reactive crowds and realistic weather effects that affect gameplay.
